div.h6: Coronavirus Information for the MPS Community

div.div:
At this time, the Milton Public Schools is closed beginning Monday, March 16th.
Governor Baker has closed all schools (excluding residential special education schools) through the end of the academic school year.
Please direct any questions you may have to Superintendent Mary Gormley at mgormley@miltonps.org.

strong.a: Coronavirus Information for the MPS Community

div.p:
At this time, the Milton Public Schools is closed beginning Monday, March 16th.
Please click the link above for our Coronavirus Information webpage.
Governor Baker has closed all schools (excluding residential special education schools) through the end of the academic school year.
Please direct any questions you may have to Superintendent Mary Gormley at mgormley@miltonps.org.

h4.a: Coronavirus Information for the MPS Community

h3.strong: What about Food Service during the School Closing?

div.p: With the recent Statewide school closure, the Milton Public Schools is working to support our food insecure students.

Director of Food Services Jackie Morgan and her team began planning as soon as a possible school closure was discussed. Their goal is to support students during this national health crisis who rely on school breakfast and lunch each week, in a way that is efficient and easy for families while also maintaining safe practices for staff.

p.strong: Every Wednesday families can pick up 7 days of breakfasts and lunches at one time. Pick up times are 8-9am and 5-6pm at both the Tucker School (behind the school) and Milton High School (on the Canton Ave side of building).

div.p: These FREE 7 day to-go bags will contain low sugar cereal, shelf stable milk, sunbutter and jelly sandwiches, grilled cheese sandwiches, fresh fruit, fresh vegetables, and snack bags, with enough food for 7 breakfasts and 7 lunches. ANY Milton family is welcome pick up a weekly to-go bag as the goal is to support any food insecure student.
This service will be available throughout the school closure.

If you have a hardship and are in need of more convenient hours for pick up, please contact Food Service Director Jackie Morgan via email at jmorgan@miltonps.org or phone at 617-898-1051. MPS families in need of support during this time are also encouraged to email MPS Family Outreach Liaison Marti O’Keefe McKenna at mmckenna@miltonps.org.

div.h3: Student Registration during the School Closure
div.p: Contact information: Ms. Sarina Burke, Registrar, (p) 617-696-4470 x 5610 Registration@miltonps.org
Thank you for your inquiry into registering your child in the Milton Public Schools.
Effective immediately, the Milton Public Schools will be accepting online registrations for students enrolling for:

ul.li: The remainder of the 2019-20 school year
Students enrolled in private Kindergarten and wish to enroll their child in Grade 1 in the Milton Public schools for the 2020-2021 school year.

p.strong: All other registrations for the school year 2020-2021 will be conducted in July and August 2020.

p.a: Please visit our registration page for all details on student registration and to register your student who falls into the above categories.

div.p: We have compiled a comprehensive and ever changing list of Frequently Asked Questions. It is linked below and shared in each blog post. Please refer back to it often.
Please see below for two important MPS documents about the MPS Remote Learning Plan.

p.a: The Milton Public Schools COVID-19 School Closure Remote Learning Plan (Updated March 31, 2020)

div.p: Please visit our Family Resources Page for information on:

ul.li: General Resources for Children with Special Needs

div.p: If you find that you need support around locating Mental Health Resources, please consider the Milton Interface Referral Services.
This is a FREE service to support Milton residents. Visit Interface here or call them toll free at (888)-244-6843 Monday – Friday between 9:00am – 5:00pm.

a.aria-label: Milton Public Schools Online Payment Center

div.p: The Milton Public School system does not and shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, gender identity, transgender status, gender transitioning, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, pregnancy/parenting status, marital status, sexual orientation, homelessness, or military status, in any of its programs, activities or operations. These include, but are not limited to, admissions, equal access to programs and activities, hiring and firing of staff, provision of and access to programs and services, as well as selection of volunteers, vendors and employers recruiting at the Milton Public Schools. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all members of our staff, students, volunteers, subcontractors, and vendors. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies: Asst. Superintendent for Curriculum & Human Resources, Dr. Karen Spaulding, (617) 696-5040 ext. 5582.
